channel.title: Question about Apache
channel.description: Hi, I have a 24/7 server (computer, web server, and game server) so I was wondering how I can make Apache go straight to a file (index.htm) instead of going to a directory listing. Also, I have multiple No-IPs set up to go here (hosting for some people at school). I was wondering if it would be possible to make their no-ip go to their section, and make my no-ip go to my section. And I also have dot.tk redirects for sections but I wanted to give my friend both. Thanks Justis edit I think I might have solved the problems.

item.title: Question about Apache
item.dc:creator: @S_ms S!ms
item.description:
@S_ms wrote:

go to apache.conf and change DirectoryIndex to

DirectoryIndex index.htm index.html index.php index.asp

Read full topic

item.description:
@usernamelol wrote:

How can you not get xampp working? All you do is click next…

be sure at the beggining to install apache.

item.title: Question about Apache
item.dc:creator: @kloplop321 kloplop321
item.description:
@kloplop321 wrote:

have you tried “http://localhost:80/”? it should work. I suggest installing a (OS first letter)AMP server since it is pre-configured and easy to set up.

Read full topic

item.title: Question about Apache
item.dc:creator: @cooper cooper
item.description:
@cooper wrote:

Hi, I have a 24/7 server (computer, web server, and game server) so I was wondering how I can make Apache go straight to a file (index.htm) instead of going to a directory listing. Also, I have multiple No-IPs set up to go here (hosting for some people at school). I was wondering if it would be possible to make their no-ip go to their section, and make my no-ip go to my section. And I also have dot.tk redirects for sections but I wanted to give my friend both.
Thanks
Justis
edit
I think I might have solved the problems.

Read full topic
